items.cell_disruption_process: RADH cloned into the vector pET-22b(+) was expressed in E. coli BL21(DE3). Cultivation and cell disruption procedures were described elsewhere (Kulig et al., 2012).
items.concentration_determination_method: Protein concentration was determined by the Bradford method (Bradford, 1976) using bovine serum albumin as a standard.
items.special_treatment: Three purification protocols were applied: (1) without Ca2+ ions, (2) with 0.2 mmol/L CaCl2, (3) with 0.8 mmol/L CaCl2 added to all buffers. Purification steps included size exclusion chromatography (SEC) for desalting, anion exchange chromatography, and a second SEC for buffer exchange and Ca2+ adjustment. All purification steps were performed in TEA–HCl buffer (50 mmol/L, pH 7.5) at room temperature (20–25°C). For storage, enzyme was kept in TEA–HCl buffer (10 mmol/L, pH 7.5) at -20°C, or lyophilized and stored at -20°C, or in 50% (v/v) glycerol at -20°C. Addition of CaCl2 (0.2–0.8 mmol/L) during or after purification significantly increased enzyme stability. The enzyme is a trimer (native MW ~75 kDa, subunit MW 26.7 kDa). For activity and stability studies, 0.8 mmol/L CaCl2 was added to all buffers. Lyophilized enzyme requires equilibration in buffer for several hours before use to regain maximal activity.
